intro: Oxymeris acutiflora, commonly known as the sharp-flowered oxymeris, is a tropical plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, which bloom in the summer months. Oxymeris acutiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive ornamental plant in horticulture.
